conclusion: Distance from piston to bottom when elevator is stationary: L1 = 19 cm
Area of piston: S = 30 cm^2 = 30 x 10^-4 m^2
Maximum tension the rope can withstand: F = 120 N

premise: When the elevator is stationary, the pressure inside the cylinder p1 balances the weight of the piston and atmospheric pressure.
Substituting the values into the equation p1 = p0 + mg/S.
Initial volume V1 is calculated using V1 = L1 x S.
The maximum tension F the rope can withstand is 120 N. This tension occurs when the elevator accelerates upward, increasing the effective weight of the cylinder.
Solving for acceleration a using the equation F = (M + m)g + Ma.
The pressure inside the cylinder p2 when the elevator accelerates upward is calculated using p2 = p0 + (m + Ma)/S.
Since the process is isothermal, p1V1 = p2V2.
The new distance L2 is calculated using L2 = V2/S.
